bug.author: kkasravi
bug.description:
steps to reproduce
kfctl init dls-kf --platform gcp --project $PROJECT --disable_usage_report --namespace=dls-kf --version=v0.6.start --skip-init-gcp-project --package-manager=kustomize@pull/207/head CLIENT_ID=xxx CLIENT_SECRET=yyy kfctl generate all --zone=us-west1-a CLIENT_ID=xxx CLIENT_SECRET=yyy kfctl apply all --verbose kfctl delete all --delete_storage
checking the deployment manager in the gcp console shows that the storage remains

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

As part of the fix we should update the E2E test to verify that its cleaned up <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/testing/kfctl/kfctl_delete_test.py>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/testing/kfctl/kfctl_delete_test.py</denchmark-link>
verified it's not working in v0.7.0
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/120>#120</denchmark-link> removes the flag - now you need to set this value to gcp plugin in KfDef.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gabrielwen>@gabrielwen</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
/close
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
